poem:
Title: Wonder in a Capitalist Dawn

In crimson sunrise, Nikkei sighs a record high,
as Rolls-Royce dreams roil and Lloyds' profits multiply.
With a £450m mote in their corporate eye,
due echoes of an investigation nigh.

Motor finance customers like seagulls cry,
over suspicion of loans that lie.
In a world ripe with such peculiar dye,
It is the uncertainty that I lieth.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Japan’s Nikkei hits record high; Lloyds and Rolls-Royce profits surge – business live 8.02am GMT Lloyds Banking Group has been forced to put aside £450m for potential fines and compensation for motor finance customers, after the UK regulator opened an investigation into whether consumers had been charged inflated prices for car loans. The lender, which also owns the Bank of Scotland and Halifax brands, said there was “significant uncertainty” over the extent of any misconduct". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
